zone.line: O that no wing me from the ground lifted
You further & ever further to strive.
I see in the eternal evening beam
The still world at my feet
Is in flamed all the high, hushed this vale
The silver brook in golden streams flies
Nought hinders then the godlike course
The wild mountain with all its ravines.
Already does the sea itself with warm inlets
For the astonished beams to
Then seems the Goddess at last away to sink
Alone the new impulse wakes,
its
I hasten it forth eternal light to drink,
Before me the day, & behind me the night
The heavens over me & under me the waves
A beautiful dream meanwhile escapes
Ah to the spirits' wings will so light
No bodily wing itself accompany.
Yet is it every native
That thy feeling down & forward throngs
